website_summaries.verdict: Massive open world game allows players to explore and level up in their own way. Beautifully created ancient world.
pros: Stunning, ancient Greece is recreated, including mythological figures and ruins
Gameplay and combat on both land and sea
Seemingly unlimited side quests and endless gameplay
Ability to choose a male or female character is a plus
cons: So many options may be exhausting
it’s easy to get distracted from the main quest
Mostly abandons original Assassin’s Creed framework

customer_reviews.title: Perfect World
customer_reviews.text: I love the Assassins Creed series and never had a problem with yearly releases and don't care about similarities between the new release and past titles as every entry is beautifully done and gives a window into the culture they are indulging themselves in. I had really wanted an ancient China scenario with some martial arts and was not very excited about a journey to Greece but after playing for 10 hours I will say easily this is graphically the most beautiful in the series and the story is very engaging. More combat focused than previous titles which is a nice change. The RPG element is also a nice addition and the franchise continues to grow and evolve.
customer_reviews.author: zx2781

customer_reviews.title: Too "new."
customer_reviews.text: Controls are new, unwieldy, and annoying. Special powers abilities (hold L1 and press one of twelve buttons to do do x-power), a more awkward counter/block system (holding L1 and R1 at the same time), make the came awkward, overly complicated, and not fun anymore. As the game moves more towards skill points and giant skill trees, the magic of the original few games is taken away.
customer_reviews.author: Will Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye Bayek. Hello Alexio.
customer_reviews.text: Origins left some large shoes to fill. So far Odyssey has filled them. I’ve spent about ten hours in the game. The map is huge. It is like Origins and Black flag in one. Expansive land campaign with expansive sea campaign. There are some bugs. But it’s ot been out s day.
customer_reviews.author: Kev. Co.

customer_reviews.title: Spartans Creed
customer_reviews.text: This game is essentially a mix of Black Flag and Origins, but with out the legit assassins. This game focuses heavily on ship battle and constant gear grinding, both entertaining for a while, but become stale after a few hours. The combat is fun and spartan kicking people is bad ass for sure. The story is OK and what I really like is the "Witcher" type dialog choices that have real consequences, unlike previous entries. Overall this is a beautiful game with some fun mechanics, but the loot grind can be a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: A bit of fun but not very compelling
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are amazing. The sailing between islands in Greece is great fun. The combat system is okay. The story is not surprising so far and not engaging enough to keep me coming back. I may decide to just stop playing instead of finishing the game. For me, it is too one-dimensional, you are just slashing haphazardly at the world, with no sense of building or adding to the world. I want to like it, but I just can't seem to care about the characters or the stories. Probably spoiled by Skyrim, Far Cry, and Fallout. Sometimes I just fly around as an eagle to enjoy the landscape and escape the frenetic "storyline" - not a good omen.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: So many hours
customer_reviews.text: I'm at the 200+ hr mark as I write this review. This is including both DLC's. With games like this, I am the type that likes to do EVERYTHING, hence the insane amount of hours. Some objectives in the main game do get a little repetitive, okay A LOT repetitive, but the beauty of the world and the amazing performance by Kassandra's actor makes up for it. (Haven't played Alexios) Anywho, if you really liked Origins, I'm sure you'll like this one too.
customer_reviews.author: Wondrous Riss

customer_reviews.title: Solid game I like it
customer_reviews.text: Love the game especially since it has the whole spartan soldier vibe world to it. Been always wanting to play a good spartan kick ass game for a longtime. I know it’s a assassins creed doesn’t feel like it at all honestly but still love the whole new feel to it. Such as black flags didn’t seem like an assassins creed game but I still loved it since it was about pirates and shizz. Still a fan of the series don’t know about the other guys but I like that gameplay and story. Only assassins creed I didn’t feel was origins just cuz the fighting seemed a little stiff to me. But odyssey felt a little better in fighting mechanics.
customer_reviews.author: SlumDiggity

customer_reviews.title: Incredible game - think Witcher 3 with a female lead
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this game. It's everything I've been waiting for from an open world game, and it has delivered. It's heavily influenced by Witcher 3, from the world options to the questing - but none of Geralt's annoying instadeath falls. Instead of just robbing shipments as you can in Origins, you can also pick up crafting materials from the world. There are a lot of caves to explore, the naval combat and large-scale battles are fun, and most of the quests don't feel like busywork.
customer_reviews.author: Modern Xena

customer_reviews.title: Travel back to Ancient Greece with Alexios & Kassandra
customer_reviews.text: Oh gosh I could go on and on about how much I love this game but I’ll spare you. Many people compare it to the original games with Ezio. I love both the OG Assassin's Creed and Odyssey. Both have a different feel. I personally love this game because you can do whatever you want, the sites are beautiful, Kassandra’s voice acting is filled with passion, and depending on how you play the game you can get a different outcome.
customer_reviews.author: CatsCatsCats

customer_reviews.title: Incredible experience.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve played many of the other Assassin Creed games, but this is by far my favorite. It’s such a fun beautiful world to explore. I really enjoy the main female character and the player choice. The ease of changing talent points let’s you experiment and find the play style that suits you best (I prefer ranged). My favorite thing to do is hunting down other mercenaries and clearing enemy strongholds. Though I’ve sunk many hours into the game I appreciate that I can jump in for half an hour or less and feel like I made some progression.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Noble

customer_reviews.title: Really had lots of fun!  Challenging but so enjoyable.
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed this game even though I haven’t played many Assasains Creed games. Just the Greek lore of the game is so fun! It plays well, had lots of fun with this, but I did eventually get stuck because it does get quite challenging later in the game. I’ll definitely pick it back up someday though. I’d recommend buying if you’re on the fence.
customer_reviews.author: Throwback Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Addicting!
customer_reviews.text: I love how they beautifully incorporate history of Ancient Greece and mythologies. The gameplay was awesome and addicting too. The open world map is beautiful as I let my character stand sometimes to admire the view the scenery. It was interesting to see how your actions affect the story because you do not know the immediate cause till later on, and the choice may bite you in the back despite how good your intentions were. I like exploring while discovering new places and things. Overall, this is a major improvement considering its previous games.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth-Agnes

customer_reviews.title: Love Games Story hated the grind
customer_reviews.text: I love the game's story and combat but like Origins behind it I really don’t like the direction Assassin’s Creed is going if I wanted to play an action RPG I’ll go with the Tales series or Dark Souls still am a big fan of the series but since it’s going this direction this is my final game of the series micro transactions kills games and I refuse to spend it on that but easily had over 100 hours playing this game never again sorry Ubisoft I got a family to take care off!
customer_reviews.author: Juni

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Ancient Follow-Up
customer_reviews.text: Excellent story, challenging gameplay. Can be repititive and boring after a while, but is a worthy sequel after Assassin’s Creed Origins. I would place this as one of the top Assassin’s Creed games to date. If you are not a fan and are getting into the series this is a good starter that is suttle enough from the main overall storyline so you are not missing a thing. A great game for this year in all.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Rebholz

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Open World Expierence!
customer_reviews.text: Havnt played Assassins Creed since Black Flag came out a couple years back. What interested me most is the time period this game takes place in. It's beautiful, immersive, and a great time killer. My only problem with it is that it does not feel like a traditional Assassins Creed title. It's different but I'm enjoying thus far, definitely recommend it to anyone who loves history and/or ancient mythology.
customer_reviews.author: ag22876

customer_reviews.title: This is Sparta!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is so much to do in this game it's almost overwhelming. The ships are back so I'm excited about that, the animals are ruthless as usual. I've only came across one glitch where I had to restart the game, other than that the game is really fun to play. The combat is fun especially spartan kicking enemies off ledges might be my favorite thing. There is a bit of a grind but I like those types of games so it doesn't bother me and the game is all around beautiful. Definitely a must for endless hours of play, definitely get your monies worth.
customer_reviews.author: cody

customer_reviews.title: Assassins Creed Odyssey is a Great Game
customer_reviews.text: I was never big Assassins Creed fan but I really like open world games and once I got tired of RDR2 I decided to try this game out and I am really glad I did. If you like open world games with an expansive world and a lot to do you will like this game. I have been playing it for over a month and still look forward to turning it on after work. I have since ordered Assassins Creed Origin and am looking forward to playing that once I have completed this game
customer_reviews.author: Clint Town

customer_reviews.title: I love Spartans!
customer_reviews.text: Sparta! Awesome customizable characters with skill trees and legendary sets. Well done. The fighting mechanism isn't as good as old ones but the world quest and story lines are exceptionally fantastic. I enjoyed very much. Now that the price is down its even more attractive. I've played though every Assassin's creeds franchises and this is my favorite game play. You get to wear awesome Athens and Spartans Greek ancient gears
customer_reviews.author: Cloud

customer_reviews.title: Glitches, but fun.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, but it’s thee MOST glitched creed game I’ve ever played. I play on PS4. And every now and then it’ll freeze frame and pause. Sometimes it loads up like ok it’s cathcing up, other times I’ve just closed the game. Dunno what’s special about this one to cause the issue. But that’s my experience. Like I said though, overall fun game.
customer_reviews.author: blake

customer_reviews.title: Watch Out For The Grind
customer_reviews.text: Not really a review but a warning. This game features a sizable grind that comes out of left field in its third act. It's very similar to how Middle Earth: Shadow Of War was during its first year of release. No matter your character level, you will reach a story point where a new quest-line requires a 5 to 6 level character increase to complete. Essentially, Ubisoft wants you to buy XP boosters from the in-game store (good old micro-transactions) to finish the final act of the main campaign or grind on fetch quests and area activities for 12-15 hours. You may want to hold off until they eventually patch this out.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fun even for those not super into the AC games
customer_reviews.text: This was my first AC game since the very first. I played HZD and God of War right beforehand, which was a perfect transition to Odyssey. For anyone who loves open world, quest-based games, and Greek mythology, you'll love this. Graphics are gorgeous, Kassandra's voice acting is fantastic, and she's super fun to play as. Not to mention, you'll get your money's worth in game time. I'm 80 hours in and not finished with the main story yet.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: best Assassin's Creed game in the series
customer_reviews.text: I know this game isnt really about Assassins or anything really revolved around them that much it is really good (trust me). If this is your first Assassin's Creed game u might wanna play the first few games and if an RPG-like Assassin's Creed isnt what u want, then don't get it. (My opinion) I honestly love everything about this game, even the RPG-like mechanics and the stunning beautiful graphics. 10/10 definitely recommend 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: Justin Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: Loved every hour of it (roughly 77). Great plot, great characters, scenes that almost put me to tears. Most decisions you make really don't have a long term impact on the plot (except the ones that involve the character's family). Bounty hunters will ruin the game for you. All in all I love this game.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Fan from the beginning, best since 2!
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal game. I’ve played since 1 and haven’t missed an entry, I must admit while I liked origins I struggled to finish it, this game I can’t put down. Just the right amount of assassins creed, story, combat Everything is so much fun. Really a great game and pinnacle of the series gameplay wise but could use more of that “assassins” feel as if they removed the AC name it wouldn’t change much
customer_reviews.author: George F.

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of open world RPGs like in the Fallout and Elder Scrolls series. I never got into the first Assassin's games but decided to give this one a try. It's really a great game in terms open world exploring and things to do. The combat system takes some getting used to but it also shines. Im also enjoying the storyline. The graphics are the best I've seen yet on PS4. I would highly recommend it to anyone who had a slight interest.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander P. Boyko

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game!
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun game! The map in this game is HUGE and the islands are beautiful. Spartan kicking guys off of cliffs then launching arrows into them is entertaining. There is so much to do and see and there is a lot of gameplay. The leveling up and fighting mercenaries that come after you when you raise your bounty is terrifying at first then just awesome after your character gets built up more. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best price
customer_reviews.text: My son wanted this game. I said,”I can get it on amazon for cheap!”. He said “no, I’ll get it through PS4 for the best price”. I was like, we’ll see.... turns out it was less expensive on amazon! HA! BURN! Anyway, he loves it. He says the map is much larger than most games. Also, he’s a huge fan of realism and history. So... , he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Balaoing

customer_reviews.title: Game freezes
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong I love the game but it freezes up too often.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost

customer_reviews.title: AC in Greece! Yes please.
customer_reviews.text: Will have you screaming “This is Sparta” quite often. Haven’t played a lot of AC since brotherhood. Played Black Flag for a little but didn’t get super into it like I thought I would have. Crazy the amount of stuff you can do in this game. I love it and have been putting a lot of hours into it. Definitely recommend if you like AC games or are into Greek culture.
customer_reviews.author: S.L.

customer_reviews.title: Glitchy but an amazing game!!
customer_reviews.text: This game is amazing!!!! I love it more than Origins. The only issue I am having is that the game is glitchy, it made me think if it might have been the game system but I tested it on other games and it was fine. Even when the game gets glitchy the system still reacts and works. That is the only thing negative about this game other than that I’m loving it! I have been telling my friends and family that enjoy video games to go and buy it because of how much fun it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Determined for you...  Instead of you sandboxing
customer_reviews.text: Bought the game, love the look and play.... but it seems repetitive and very focussed on only one way through the game and the NPC dialog annoys me... I put it down after 2 sessions of playing it. Was disappointed while impressed, moved onto something better instead of spending time on this.
customer_reviews.author: Edster

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Engrossing
customer_reviews.text: I pumped god knows how many hours into this game. This is by far the best in the franchise. I'll keep it simple: you're a badass Spartan in ancient Greece. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: octbr

customer_reviews.title: Gjfd
customer_reviews.text: Great game! It's more refined than Origins but there is too much dialogue when getting missions. You can't go out and farm resources like wood and iron ore and sell it for drachma. The fight mechanics are the best in any Assassin's Creed game I've seen and the map is HUGE. Lots of content in this game. It's fun to Spartan kick the bad guys off the ship during sea battles. The conquest battles are a nice addition to the game.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Great game but!!!  4 to 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome is a bit repetitive, once you download the HUGE patches it's a lot of fun ship battles ,and huge world to explore is great the tree's ,and some graphics are great ,while faces are cut and paste, the women look ugly, they seem to have spent a little more time on the men NPC but not much. I really wish they gave half stars 3.5 would be my score
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Not like any other assassins creed!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh THE BEST assassins creed ever made I love the way this game is a rpg and open world fully. I hope to God they keep it like this from here on out the game is just incredible a finished work of art a masterpiece of their collection. THE DIAMOND OF 2018
customer_reviews.author: GrowingFamily18

customer_reviews.title: Great game but...
customer_reviews.text: I love this game and the world they created but I wasnt a big fan of assasination skill change. I used to enjoy the stealth kills but this game allows you to customize your fighting skills. As a fan of assassin creed every little change bugs me, I enjoy it when it's consistent. Which is why Origins and Unity will always be my favorite!
customer_reviews.author: Lightening

customer_reviews.title: Loading times are absurd
customer_reviews.text: This game just is too long with long loading time. It’s too annoying of a game
customer_reviews.author: Paulo Ferreira Goncalves

customer_reviews.title: Its good.
customer_reviews.text: It's a solid game, great story and fluid combat. I think my biggest complaint is the developers spent all this time making a huge world, and then didnt put enough stuff in it. The world just feels empty. But it's still a good game, there just isnt a need to explore everthing.
customer_reviews.author: 11celle

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun
customer_reviews.text: As AC moves to a more non-linear experience, the fun level rises. I like having options to play as I choose. The scenery is fantastic. The soundscape is wonderful The voice acting for Kassandra is very good. For value for money, it's terrific. About one cent per hour of gameplay and getting lower every day!
customer_reviews.author: John Kitchen

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: In fairness, I’ll admit to being a Roman junkie so while my preference was to be during this time period, having it 350 years prior to Caesar is close enough. Gameplay is smooth, reminds me a lot of Arkham Knight and Shadow of War, and if you’re like me out can get just as much enjoyment sailing the seas and taking on pirates. Only downside is a requirement to play side missions more than normal, otherwise I enjoyed this one so much I went and bought Origins...and a Season pass
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic game
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game, it's massive. I have probably well over 24 hours into the game and still have yet to explore even half the map. I've read some complaints about micro-transactions, I agree they shouldn't even be in AAA titles but I've not even opened that feature and don't feel it's necessary at all to complete/enjoy the game.
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: The most incredibile adventure for ancient greek fans!
customer_reviews.text: Huge game, too hug for my taste. Incredible graphics, my biggest regret is the lack of shield and the mythological creatures are fun but doesn't fit.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Kindle

customer_reviews.title: Addicted to this game
customer_reviews.text: There is SO MUCH to do. I can't imagine being able to 100% this game any time soon and I love that. It's fantastic that ubisoft has been adding new ideas and concepts to the games recently, making one of my all time favorite games series stay fresh and interesting. AC fans will enjoy for sure, and if this is your first time looking into the world of Assassin's Creed, you won't be overwhelmed or lost, and will definitely will enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: haley

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: First off I havnt played origins. I played half of black flag and it's similar but waaaaay better. The scale of the game is massive and the details of history is wonderful. This is a masterpiece game of the year 2019 runner up. If you like rpg and history do yourself a favor and buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Mangoicetea92

customer_reviews.title: Gave up after the pigs...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this game, having enjoyed others in the series. Overall it felt rushed and not well developed. The voice acting is terrible and distracting. This game feels like a chore to play and eventually I got so frustrated I just gave up and stopped playing. I'd skip this one and save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Dreamer

customer_reviews.title: My wife hates this game because she says I am obsessed with it.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think my wife's statement is completely fair, it's just that the game is more interesting than relationships. And jobs. And hygiene.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Super game, great fun.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this game, maybe more than Black Flag. Super story, fun history. But one thing I HATE about AC games - Abstergo. It disrupts the flow of the game. It’s annoying and seems like a programmers way of gloating how wonderful they are.
customer_reviews.author: jrd

customer_reviews.title: It's fun
customer_reviews.text: First AC game since the original. This is much better. My inly issue is I wish there was more variety in the strikes. R1 and R2 are your only 2 attacks. My only real complaint is how the voice actors mis-pronounce some of the names/places.
customer_reviews.author: P H.

customer_reviews.title: At $30 this game is worth picking up!
customer_reviews.text: Addictive gameplay loop. Beautiful world design. Side quests are 90% filler but still kinda fun to complete. Cultist and mercenary systems are great! This game is a complete time sinker. Not ideal for a player with limited time as AC Odyssey is huge! It’s been fun leveling up and getting new gear even though enemies scale with you. At $30 this game is worth picking up.
customer_reviews.author: P. Ng

customer_reviews.title: Great game, worth the price
customer_reviews.text: What a fun and beautiful game. I do think they get a little repetitive if you buy the new version each year but on it's own this is a great game with a ton to do. The hours of gameplay keep you interested as with the open world you choose which direction you take your character.
customer_reviews.author: zach holly

customer_reviews.title: Received wrong region
customer_reviews.text: As the picture shows, this should be an NA game, but I received a European copy. Now this isn't an issue, if they don't release DLC, but like all other games. DLC is most likely, so I can't download it using my NA PSN. Wish I was told this was the European copy, otherwise I would not have made the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Great game if you like rpg games and long story games
customer_reviews.text: Love the game I knew what to expect from the reviews of this game it's great the game is very well made and lots of things to do in the game, it took me like over 60 hours to beat the game because I was doing all the missions and side quests too which are fun to do.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfred Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Plays more like Skyrim than Assassins Creed
customer_reviews.text: Great game - 40 hours in with no end in sight. A ton of content. Great combat mechanics, graphics, storyline. Voice actors lay on the accents a little thick. So many questlines its almost overwhelming.
customer_reviews.author: stagecoach66

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: So much action. Open world. Assassin's Creed. Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: At 75 hours and level 45, I probabsly haven't completed half of this game
customer_reviews.text: If you like ancient Greek mythology and you would like to go on a rampage stabbing people, then this game is definitely for you. I have tied up about $150 in freemium goodies so far, and as an entertainment investment, it was completely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Playable and Watchable
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my fiancé who totally loves it, and I know this for sure because it’s like talking to a brick wall when he’s playing the game. I enjoy it too, from a different position; much like the other AC’s, it’s quite watchable to an outsider if you’re just vegging out, so that’s a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa B

customer_reviews.title: Best game I've played in 2018!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this game,from the beautiful landscapes of ancient Greece to the fun and addictive gameplay. The story and characters were well written and developed,although I preferred playing as kassandra over alexios as I find Alexander's voice actor was better.
customer_reviews.author: James Sherland

customer_reviews.title: We love this game
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I both love this game. Open world with plenty of variety, tons of quests, enough humor to keep it fun but not overdone. We can each play in our own preferred fighting styles, building our characters accordingly. I have a tad over 100 hours into the game and still find it very fun and engaging. I can't recommend this game enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: 5th favorite out of the 11 games.
customer_reviews.text: Good game. Kinda a hybrid between Origins and Black Flag. Nowhear as good as Origins and I preferred Odysseys characters and storyline to the from Black Flag.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: A big improvement over previous installments.
customer_reviews.text: Get this game. Very big improvement over previous assassins creed installments. All the mechanics of old are blended in with a new RPG style and a choice system! I am having so much fun being able to make my own choices in games again! Last time I felt I had this much freedom with choices was Mass Effect. Absolutely a 10/10 game.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I've played every assassin's creed game besides Origins and I held off on buying Odyssey, because I was afraid I wouldn't like the new RPG elements. I was wrong to not buy it sooner, because I ended playing this game for about 3 weeks straight, pouring over 100 hours into it. There's so much to do in the game and I still haven't finished it after playing 100+ hrs!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic game for any RPG fan not just Assassin’s Creed fanatics.
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a fan of open world RPG’s this is a game for you. You don’t have to be a fan of Assassin’s Creed to enjoy this game. It’s a beautiful game full of fantastic sites, history and the gameplay is perfect. Easily 100+ hours of content make this game a rare gem. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Aarskringspier

customer_reviews.title: It's the best AC yet
customer_reviews.text: This game is great. I don't play it as much as I'd like, but every time I play it's a lot of fun. The hours fly by. Great story. I love the controls. I can't wait to see what the AC team comes up next with the series.
customer_reviews.author: George Brugess

customer_reviews.title: Cannot open game
customer_reviews.text: I cannot open the game with this disc. It keeps saying error after I inserted it. I tried everything and I re-constructed my PS4 database in safe mode, still cannot open the game. And when I returned this disc, they charged me half the price for "re-stocking fee". What a waste of time and money. It's a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Yuanfan

customer_reviews.title: Bought Game for my Son. He actually played it!
customer_reviews.text: I got this game for my son. You know how that is, right? Sometimes they play it and sometimes it's an absolute waste of money. He got it. He loved it. He beat it! That makes me "Dad of the Year" until the next game I try to buy.
customer_reviews.author: George Borghardt

customer_reviews.title: Extensive game plan
customer_reviews.text: The number of side missions is terrific but there is almost too much flexibility in how you can execute them. Easy to get bored trying to get player level high enough to complete certain tasks. Game play itself it pretty solid and the developers did a good job of melding some of the best items from past games into the new version.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Fabrizius

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and fun
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't bother reviewing the games I play, but this one is seriously fun. I've played a few of the AC games. I played 1, 2, and black flag. This is a change, and a change for the better. Very fun, huge, and packed with options; fun combat, fun story, fun sidequests. Pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Versus23

customer_reviews.title: Good game with some bugs
customer_reviews.text: I really like Odyssey. The setting is nice. The graphics are beautiful. The gameplay mechanic is good. But there are some game halting bugs. Sometimes when looking around, the top half of character models will disappear and the frame rate then drops to around 5. It clunks so bad. Very much looking forward to patches.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Small

customer_reviews.title: A decent entry in the series
customer_reviews.text: Its a decent entry in the series. Sort of a game-play refresh, alongside its predecessor, Origins. It was a good lengthy adventure, but doesn't have a lot of replayability.
customer_reviews.author: Fan Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Series!
customer_reviews.text: Best AC game of the series to date! Graphics are incredible and the customizations options make the game super enjoyable to play. Lots of Easter Eggs for old fans but plenty of action for new ones.
customer_reviews.author: MR1453

customer_reviews.title: Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this game. Ubisoft finally went the right route. I was worried about them releasing another game right after origins without a gap year but it was amazing. Loved every bit of it. Loved that u decide how u want ur character to be throughout the game, have multiple endings and have an option of deciding what you want to do instead of having to follow a scripted story (which is still good). The graphics were amazing. I would definitely suggest this game to anyone as it has so many things you could do
customer_reviews.author: Jaison Joykutty

customer_reviews.title: Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: I am a huge fan of the franchise, but this honestly doesn't feel like an Assassins Creed game. The combat takes getting used to and the story so far isn't anything captivating. All in all, I'm enjoying the gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: DanIsYoBoi

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Amazing game.
customer_reviews.text: This game does SO much to improve upon the AC series. Wow. I can't do justice with a review. Absolutely buy this and experience Greece yourself.
customer_reviews.author: casey

customer_reviews.title: Best Assasin's Creed
customer_reviews.text: So last year Origins shook things up a bit. This shook it up even more adding a lot more RPG elements and dialouge choices to the game. I love it. One of the best Assasin's Creed games and hopefully a sign of more things to come with the series.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlueGrassCat

customer_reviews.title: The teenage girl I bought this for loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Her mom is angry at me because the girl plays it ALL the time. She enjoys it a lot so it must be very fun. I only briefly saw it, and it looked okay but she's totally immersed in it.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Another Fantastic AC Game!
customer_reviews.text: Thank goodness I’m retired because this game is so addicting I’m up until all hours playing it. Odyssey is one of their best games yet! So much to do that it will take months to complete. Seriously! So much fun!
customer_reviews.author: pk3

customer_reviews.title: Solid A/C game, very long story.
customer_reviews.text: Game is great, graphics are what you expect in a modern game, oceans are beautiful. I brougbt the game a few months back and still havent beat it, theres just so much stuff to do, and the map is so huge, just when you think youve explored a area you are quickly reminded that across the sea there are a lot more to explore.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to complain  about
customer_reviews.text: It's not as good as origins I feel like. The 5 dollar price drop after I bought less than a month short of stings. Alot of busy work. But these games make me happy so I can't really conplain.
customer_reviews.author: David Boyce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. Cannot wait until the next. Tamed animals are the best. Have loved at sea since Black Flag. Weapon choices are endless.
customer_reviews.author: floresfamilynic

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: The ship battles are even better than AC: Black Flag! Love the Greece setting and game play. If you liked AC: origins you will like this game too. I don't get hung up on the open world style vs older AC game style.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother and he enjoyed it a lot. He said it reminded him a bit of a roman-style Shadow of Mordor. I think I got this for like 15 dollars so pretty darn good price for a game these days
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Assassin's Creed
customer_reviews.text: Me and my son have all the Assassins Creed. This one is not a disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Michael Garner

customer_reviews.title: A good upgrade to origins
customer_reviews.text: This is an upgrade on origins. Although I dislike that there are no more one hit assassinations. That was the whole point of being sneaky. Now it’s not worth it to be sneaky. Otherwise it’s a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for AC fans.
customer_reviews.text: One of the best in the series. It’s not quite brotherhood but we know nothing ever will be and this one tries. A pleasant surprise was the addition of naval combat like in Black flag. If I had to sum up Odyssey, I would say assassin’s creed meets the Witcher.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Thelen

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME GAME
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend and I both love it. I personally have never played any games from the Assassin’s Creed series, but the game goes off it’s own story so it doesn’t matter.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Game
customer_reviews.text: Story is great and the combat is actually good compared to other ac games. They really put a lot of strategy behind taking down enemies and the story isn't something you can finish in a weekend. The boss fights are somewhat similar but still provide great value and are a great experience
customer_reviews.author: Ishabul haque

customer_reviews.title: Thought this was a “bargain” @ $20
customer_reviews.text: Heck no. All of these false claims that this assasins creed is great and has an awesome story is completely exaggerated. It’s boring, bland, and repetitive. I honestly couldn’t play more than 20 mins in one sitting since I purchased it over a month ago.
customer_reviews.author: Actually bought the item

customer_reviews.title: GOD AWFUL
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this hot pile of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: CaliforniaLuv84

customer_reviews.title: RPG large open world
customer_reviews.text: RPG and the biggest map yet. I picked this up $16.00 new. That said I’ve not gotten originals as of yet
customer_reviews.author: Yosemitesam

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun. I chose Alexios and I'm glad I did. I just started but am focused on exploring the land and expanding the map while doing side quests and leveling up. Takes a bit to learn the combat system but it's becoming easier.
customer_reviews.author: MinhcallaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Quantity over Quality
customer_reviews.text: This game is not bad but def an example of Quantity of Quality. You will tons of things to do but you may not enjoy doing those things...Gets repetitive & boring after doing those same activities over & over again.
customer_reviews.author: Gaurav

customer_reviews.title: AC Odyssey
customer_reviews.text: This game is a great time! I usually beat games within a week of hardcore game play. However, I've been working on this one every single day for months and it still has yet to truly end. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tesla

customer_reviews.title: Love the new Open World RPG direction the series has taken.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing, I have been a fan of Assassin's Creed from the beginning and personally I feel that it has only gotten better with the release of Origins and Odyssey. Really gives you the opportunity to play however your want.
customer_reviews.author: JimGunn

customer_reviews.title: Must be a great game
customer_reviews.text: Christmas present for my grandson the Gamer. He stayed up most of the night, he just could not walk away. It has to be very good to capture this kid's attention.
customer_reviews.author: W P N

customer_reviews.text: Repetitive quests terrible voice acting and a potential levying of pay to win keep this game from being a masterpiece.
customer_reviews.author: dylan thompson wages

customer_reviews.title: Great Game
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game for my boyfriend. I’m going to assume it’s a great game since now he likes to ignore me.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel

customer_reviews.title: Fun if you have 7 days of free time.
customer_reviews.text: Fun game that took me like 100+ hours to beat the game, didn’t finish every quest either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Teen approved
customer_reviews.text: My 17 and 21-year-old boys requested this game. They were both instantly sucked in. The graphics were very cool, and the storylines were interesting. The game was a Christmas gift, and after opening the game, I barely saw them for three days. That's always a sign they enjoy what they are playing.
customer_reviews.author: elledeelle

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, fun and full of content
customer_reviews.text: Closest experience to Black Flag with so much more content! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Guillaume

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for gamer!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this game as a gift for my nephew, he was excited to receive it. He loves it! Shipping was extremely fast! It saved me a few bucks as well.
customer_reviews.author: Clara hackworth

product_meta.title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey - PlayStation 4 Standard Edition
product_meta.description: Write your own epic odyssey and become a legendary Spartan hero. Forge your destiny in a world on the brink of tearing itself apart. Influence how history unfolds in an ever-changing world shaped by your choices.
feature_bullets: LEGENDARY SPARTAN HERO Embark on your journey from outcast to legendary Spartan hero
ANCIENT GREECE AWAITS Explore an entire country full of unexpected encounters in untamed environments and bustling ancient cities
Choose your path your choices shape the world around you. Play in a living world that constantly reacts to your every decision
FIGHT EPIC BATTLES: Charge into epic clashes between Sparta and Athens in battles pitting 150 v 150 soldiers against each other
SAIL THE AEGEAN SEA: Recruit crew members and customize your ship as you explore and battle your way on the open seas

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars2,222 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
